trans-unit.source: NetworkTrafficRules Schema
trans-unit.target: NetworkTrafficRules Schema

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node is an optional element in the service definition file that specifies how roles communicate with each other.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node is an optional element in the service definition file that specifies how roles communicate with each other.

trans-unit.source: It limits which roles can access the internal endpoints of the specific role.
trans-unit.target: It limits which roles can access the internal endpoints of the specific role.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not a standalone element; it is combined with two or more roles in a service definition file.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is not a standalone element; it is combined with two or more roles in a service definition file.

trans-unit.source: The default extension for the service definition file is .csdef.
trans-unit.target: The default extension for the service definition file is .csdef.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node is only available using the Azure SDK version 1.3 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Basic service definition schema for the network traffic rules
trans-unit.target: Basic service definition schema for the network traffic rules

trans-unit.source: The basic format of a service definition file containing network traffic definitions is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The basic format of a service definition file containing network traffic definitions is as follows.

trans-unit.source: Schema Elements
trans-unit.target: Schema Elements

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node of the service definition file includes these elements, described in detail in subsequent sections in this topic:
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node of the service definition file includes these elements, described in detail in subsequent sections in this topic:

trans-unit.source: NetworkTrafficRules Element
trans-unit.target: NetworkTrafficRules Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element specifies which roles can communicate with which endpoint on another role.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element specifies which roles can communicate with which endpoint on another role.

trans-unit.source: A service can contain one <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> definition.
trans-unit.target: A service can contain one <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>NetworkTrafficRules</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> definition.

trans-unit.source: OnlyAllowTrafficTo Element
trans-unit.target: OnlyAllowTrafficTo Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnlyAllowTrafficTo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes a collection of destination endpoints and the roles that can communicate with them.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnlyAllowTrafficTo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes a collection of destination endpoints and the roles that can communicate with them.

trans-unit.source: You can specify multiple <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnlyAllowTrafficTo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> nodes.
trans-unit.target: You can specify multiple <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>OnlyAllowTrafficTo</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> nodes.

trans-unit.source: Destinations Element
trans-unit.target: Destinations Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes a collection of RoleEndpoints than can be communicated with.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes a collection of RoleEndpoints than can be communicated with.

trans-unit.source: RoleEndpoint Element
trans-unit.target: RoleEndpoint Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RoleEndpoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes an endpoint on a role to allow communications with.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RoleEndpoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes an endpoint on a role to allow communications with.

trans-unit.source: You can specify multiple <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RoleEndpoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> elements if there are more than one endpoint on the role.
trans-unit.target: You can specify multiple <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RoleEndpoint</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> elements if there are more than one endpoint on the role.

trans-unit.source: Attribute
trans-unit.target: Attribute

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the endpoint to allow traffic to.
trans-unit.target: The name of the endpoint to allow traffic to.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the web role to allow communication to.
trans-unit.target: The name of the web role to allow communication to.

trans-unit.source: AllowAllTraffic Element
trans-unit.target: AllowAllTraffic Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AllowAllTraffic</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element is a rule that allows all roles to communicate with the endpoints defined in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>AllowAllTraffic</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element is a rule that allows all roles to communicate with the endpoints defined in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node.

trans-unit.source: WhenSource Element
trans-unit.target: WhenSource Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WhenSource</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes a collection of roles than can communicate with the endpoints defined in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>WhenSource</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element describes a collection of roles than can communicate with the endpoints defined in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node.

trans-unit.source: Attribute
trans-unit.target: Attribute

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the rule to apply when allowing communications.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the rule to apply when allowing communications.

trans-unit.source: The only valid value is currently <languageKeyword>AnyRule</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The only valid value is currently <languageKeyword>AnyRule</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: FromRole Element
trans-unit.target: FromRole Element

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FromRole</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element specifies the roles that can communicate with the endpoints defined in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FromRole</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> element specifies the roles that can communicate with the endpoints defined in the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Destinations</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> node.

trans-unit.source: You can specify multiple <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FromRole</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> elements if there are more than one role that can communicate with the endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You can specify multiple <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>FromRole</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> elements if there are more than one role that can communicate with the endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Attribute
trans-unit.target: Attribute

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name for role from which to allow communication.
trans-unit.target: The name for role from which to allow communication.
